verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of Asaph.<WH623> O God,<WH430> the heathen<WH1471> are come<WH935> into your inheritance;<WH5159> your holy<WH6944> temple<WH1964> have they defiled;<WH2930> they have laid<WH7760> Jerusalem<WH3389> on heaps.<WH5856>

The dead<WH5038> bodies<WH5038> of your servants<WH5650> have they given<WH5414> to be meat<WH3978> to the fowls<WH5775> of the heaven,<WH8064> the flesh<WH1320> of your saints<WH2623> to the beasts<WH2416> of the earth.<WH776>
Their blood<WH1818> have they shed<WH8210> like water<WH4325> round<WH5439> about Jerusalem;<WH3389> and there was none<WH369> to bury<WH6912> them.
We are become<WH1961> a reproach<WH2781> to our neighbors,<WH7934> a scorn<WH3933> and derision<WH7047> to them that are round<WH5439> about us.
How<WH5704> long,<WH5704> LORD?<WH3068> will you be angry<WH599> for ever?<WH5331> shall your jealousy<WH7068> burn<WH1197> like fire?<WH784>
Pour<WH8210> out your wrath<WH2534> on the heathen<WH1471> that have not known<WH3045> you, and on the kingdoms<WH4467> that have not called<WH7121> on your name.<WH8034>
For they have devoured<WH398> Jacob,<WH3290> and laid waste<WH8074> his dwelling<WH5116> place.
O remember<WH2142> not against us former<WH7223> iniquities:<WH5771> let your tender mercies<WH7356> speedily<WH4118> prevent<WH6923> us: for we are brought<WH1809> very<WH3966> low.<WH1809>

Help<WH5826> us, O God<WH430> of our salvation,<WH3468> for the glory<WH3519> of your name:<WH8034> and deliver<WH5337> us, and purge<WH3722> away our sins,<WH2403> for your name's<WH8034> sake.<WH4616>

Why<WH4100> should the heathen<WH1471> say,<WH559> Where<WH346> is their God?<WH430> let him be known<WH3045> among the heathen<WH1471> in our sight<WH5869> by the revenging<WH5360> of the blood<WH1818> of your servants<WH5650> which is shed.<WH8210>

Let the sighing<WH603> of the prisoner<WH616> come<WH935> before<WH6440> you; according to the greatness<WH1433> of your power<WH2220> preserve<WH3498> you those that are appointed<WH1121> to die;<WH8546>
And render<WH7725> to our neighbors<WH7934> sevenfold<WH7659> into<WH413> their bosom<WH2436> their reproach,<WH2781> with which<WH834> they have reproached<WH2778> you, O Lord.<WH136>
So we your people<WH5971> and sheep<WH6629> of your pasture<WH4830> will give you thanks<WH3034> for ever:<WH5769> we will show<WH5608> forth<WH5608> your praise<WH8416> to all generations.<WH1755>
